intro: Fimbristylis dichotoma var. nilagirica, commonly known as the Nilagiri sedge, is a flowering plant species native to the Indian subcontinent. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, commonly known as the sedge family. This perennial herb typically grows in wetland habitats, such as marshes and swampy areas, where it thrives in moist to waterlogged soils. The plant features slender, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered flower spikes that bloom during the monsoon season. Its botanical characteristics make it an important component of wetland ecosystems in its native range.
